metadata.title: CVE-2023-52670 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: rpmsg:virtio: Free driver_override when rpmsg_remove() Free driver_override whenrpmsg_remove(), otherwise the following memory leak will occur:unreferenced object 0xffff0000d55d7080 (size 128): comm "kworker/u8:2", pid56, jiffies 4294893188 (age 214.272s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): 72 70 6d73 67 5f 6e 73 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 rpmsg_ns........ 00 00 00 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 ................ backtrace:[<000000009c94c9c1>] __kmem_cache_alloc_node+0x1f8/0x320[<000000002300d89b>] __kmalloc_node_track_caller+0x44/0x70[<00000000228a60c3>] kstrndup+0x4c/0x90 [<0000000077158695>]driver_set_override+0xd0/0x164 [<000000003e9c4ea5>]rpmsg_register_device_override+0x98/0x170 [<000000001c0c89a8>]rpmsg_ns_register_device+0x24/0x30 [<000000008bbf8fa2>]rpmsg_probe+0x2e0/0x3ec [<00000000e65a68df>] virtio_dev_probe+0x1c0/0x280[<00000000443331cc>] really_probe+0xbc/0x2dc [<00000000391064b1>]__driver_probe_device+0x78/0xe0 [<00000000a41c9a5b>]driver_probe_device+0xd8/0x160 [<000000009c3bd5df>]__device_attach_driver+0xb8/0x140 [<0000000043cd7614>]bus_for_each_drv+0x7c/0xd4 [<000000003b929a36>] __device_attach+0x9c/0x19c[<00000000a94e0ba8>] device_initial_probe+0x14/0x20 [<000000003c999637>]bus_probe_device+0xa0/0xac

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
